nodes.text: Sentient 7 and the Clankers was a band that was active in the year 34 ABY. The band performed the song "Droid World," which featured on the album "Listen Up Meatbags." According to rumors heard by the droid DJ R-3X, "Droid World" caused numerous droid rebellions and was subsequently banned in seven systems. Sentient 7 and the Clankers, including keyboard player Pall Gopal, performed at a cantina on the planet Actlyon, and R-3X broadcast the band's music in the town of Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu.

Sentient 7 and the Clankers were a band whose members included the Rodian musician Pall Gopal. While performing on the planet Actlyon, the band played electric music that increased in volume and had a bass with a rapid tempo. On Actlyon, Gopal played the keyboard.

Active by the year 34 ABY, Sentient 7 and the Clankers performed the album "Listen Up Meatbags," which featured the song "Droid World." The song created uproar when it was released—the droid DJ R-3X heard rumors that it caused a number of droids to rebel, and "Droid World" was eventually banned in seven star systems. Regardless, R-3X played the song in the town of Black Spire Outpost on the planet Batuu, both at Oga's Cantina and in a broadcast on the local radio station, BSO 401.72. R-3X considered both "Droid World" and its album to be hits.

Sentient 7 and the Clankers, including Pall Gopal, played onstage at a cantina in Actlyon City on Actlyon. While the band was present, the cantina was raided by bounty hunters in search of a waitress who owed them a debt. When the raiders exited the cantina, the members of Sentient 7 and the Clankers returned to their instruments and continued to play. Gopal instead approached a patron, the smuggler Izal Garsea, who the Rodian hired to deliver a package to Batuu. On Batuu, Garsea and the farmer Julen Rakab heard a portion of "Droid World" on the radio while delivering the package, but the signal became scrambled as they departed Black Spire Outpost.

Sentient 7 and the Clankers was created for the theme park land Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge, which opened to guests at Disneyland Park and Disney's Hollywood Studios Park in 2019. Its music is featured at the Oga's Cantina bar and on the BSO 401.72 radio station, which is played as background audio in the land.
